{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thumb sucking can cause several dental problems. According to Document [7], anterior open bite is the most frequent malocclusion reported with digit sucking. Document [21] mentions that thumb sucking can cause the maxillary central incisors to tip labially and the mandibular incisors to tip lingually, resulting in an increased overjet. Document [21] also mentions that thumb sucking can result in narrowing of the upper arch, which is a constricted maxilla. Therefore, all of the options are correct.", "answer_choice": "D. All of the above."}
